intro: Spigelia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican pipevine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its tubular, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Spigelia mexicana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
